Title: Praise the true God

Verses.1:
Not to us, Lord, not to us,
	but to your name, give the glory,
	because of your mercy, and your truth.
Verses.2:
Why do the nations say,
	"Where is their God?"
Verses.3:
But our God is in heaven,
	and he does whatever he wants.
Verses.4:
Their idols; of silver and gold,
	the work of human hands.
Verses.5:
They have mouths yet cannot speak,
	eyes yet cannot see,
Verses.6:
ears yet cannot hear,
	noses yet cannot smell.
Verses.7:
They have hands yet cannot touch,
	feet yet cannot walk,
	and only silence comes from their throats.
Verses.8:
The artisans who create idols will become like them,
	along with all whose faith is in them.
Verses.9:
People of Israel, trust in the Lord;
	he is their help and shield.
Verses.10:
House of Aaron, trust in the Lord;
	he is their help and shield.
Verses.11:
All who fear him, trust in the Lord;
	he is their help and shield.
Verses.12:
The Lord remembers us
	and will bless us;
he will bless the People of Israel,
	he will bless the House of Aaron.
Verses.13:
He will bless those who fear the Lord,
	 the small with the great.
Verses.14:
May the Lord increase your blessings,
	to you and all your children.
Verses.15:
May you be blessed by the Lord,
	maker of heaven and earth.
Verses.16:
The heavens are the heavens of the Lord,
	but the earth He has given all children.
Verses.17:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
	nor do any who descend into silence.
Verses.18:
But us, we will bless the Lord,
	in this moment and forever.

Praise the Lord.

Changes: 2021-04-10 - Paul Prins: Removed Liturgical Formating from the version in the breviary, and added the 'Praise the Lord' back to the end.
